quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: -Edmund Burke

quote: What can be asserted without evidence can be dismissed without evidence.
author: -Christopher Hitchens

quote: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
author: -Voltaire

quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: -Nelson Mandela

quote: If you want to change the world, change yourself.
author: -Mahatma Gandhi

quote: All that is necessary for the triumph of evil is that good men do nothing.
author: -Edmund Burke

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: -Thomas A. Edison

quote: Science is not only a discipline of reason but, also, one of romance and passion.
author: -Stephen Hawking

quote: The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in.
author: -Morrie Schwartz

quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: -Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: -Steve Jobs

quote: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
author: -John Lennon

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: -Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: -Socrates

quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: -Robert Frost

quote: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: -Abraham Lincoln

quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: -Oscar Wilde

quote: Livet er et lære. Du må alltid lære.
author: -Mayoo

quote: The essence of the independent mind lies not in what it thinks, but in how it thinks.
author: -Christopher Hitchens

quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: -Oscar Wilde

quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: -Socrates

quote: Man is the measure of all things.
author: -Protagoras

quote: I think, therefore I am.
author: -René Descartes

quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.
author: -Jeremy Bentham

quote: Happiness is the highest good.
author: -Aristotle

quote: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four. If that is granted, all else follows.
author: -George Orwell

quote: The only true wisdom is knowing you know nothing.
author: -Socrates

quote: The only end of writing is to enable the reader better to enjoy life, or better to endure it.
author: -Samuel Johnson

quote: The will to power is the will to live, to live more intensely and fully.
author: -Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Laughter is the closest distance between two people.
author: -Victor Borge

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: -Thomas Edison

quote: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
author: -Mark Twain

quote: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
author: -Abraham Lincoln

quote: I have never been hurt by what I have not said.
author: -Calvin Coolidge

quote: I have not yet begun to fight!
author: -John Paul Jones

quote: I have no ambition in this world but one, and that is to be a fireman.
author: -Edward F. Croker

quote: I have no desire to experiment with politics.
author: -Albert Einstein

quote: I have never been lost, but I will admit to being confused for several weeks.
author: -Daniel Boone

quote: I have always found that the main obstacle to free expression is fear of ridicule.
author: -George Bernard Shaw

quote: I find that a duck’s opinion of me is very much influenced over whether or not I have bread.
author: -Mitch Hedberg

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: -John Von Neumann

quote: A sneeze travels at over 160 km/h.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
The shortest war in recorded history was between Britain and Zanzibar on 27 August 1896 lasting between 38 and 45 minutes.
The heart of a blue whale is so large that a human can swim through its arteries.
The Mona Lisa has no eyebrows because it was the fashion in Renaissance Florence to shave them.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds.
The strongest muscle in the human body, proportionate to its size, is the tongue.
A person will spend an average of 6 months in their lifetime waiting on a red light to turn green.
The largest pyramid in the world is not in Egypt, but in Mexico.
The world's largest snowflake was 38 cm wide and 20 cm thick.
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the known universe.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.'
The world's largest pig weighed over 907 kg.
The world's largest living organism is a fungus, Armillaria ostoyae, covering over 893 hectar in Oregon, USA.
The world's oldest piece of chewing gum is over 9,000 years old.
The world's largest snowman was 34.14 m tall and made of over 3,218 tonnes of snow.
A bolt of lightning can reach temperatures of up to 30,000 kelvin (53,540°F).
A cat has a specialized collar bone that always lets it land on its feet.
The world's largest amusement park, Worlds of Fun, is in Missouri, US and covers over 94 ha.
The world's fastest ant is the Saharan silver ant, which can travel up to 1 meter per second.
Bacteria in your gut are responsible for producing serotonin, which affects mood, appetite and sleep.
The tallest mountain in the solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars, standing at a height of 22 km.
The world's oldest surviving plant is a Great Basin bristlecone pine tree, estimated to be over 5,000 years old.
The speed of light is constant, at 299,792,458 meters per second.
The Statue of Liberty was a gift from the people of France to the United States.
The Earth is tilted at an angle of 23.5 degrees on its axis.
The first email was sent in 1971 by computer engineer Ray Tomlinson.
The heart of a shrimp is located in its head.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different scents.
The human brain can process information at a speed of 120 meters per second.
The world's largest flower, the Rafflesia arnoldii, can grow up to 100 cm in diameter and weigh up to 10 kg.
The shortest river in the world is the Roe River in Montana, USA, measuring only 61 meters long.
The largest desert in the world is the Antarctic Desert, covering an area of 14 million km².
The shortest war in history took place between Britain and Zanzibar on 27 August 1896 lasting between 38 and 45 minutes.
A person's nose and ears never stop growing.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth, visible from space.
The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in his book 'If I Ran the Zoo.'
The shortest war in recorded history lasted only 38 minutes.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
The largest volcano in our solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars.
Birds are the only animals with feathers.
The world's largest island is Greenland.
The smallest mammal in the world is the bumblebee bat.
The world's largest ocean is the Pacific Ocean.
A sneeze travels at over 160 km/h.
The human brain contains more connections than there are stars in the Milky Way galaxy.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
Elephants are the only animals that can't jump.
The world's largest snowflake was 38 cm wide and 20 cm thick.
The first video game, 'Tennis for Two,' was played on an oscilloscope in 1958.
The world's tallest building is the Burj Khalifa in Dubai, standing at 828 meters tall.
A person blinks an average of 10 times per minute.
The largest flower in the world is the Rafflesia arnoldii, which can grow up to one meter in diameter.
The fastest ant in the world is the Saharan silver ant, which can travel up to 1 meter per second.
The world's first stock market was the Amsterdam Stock Exchange in the Netherlands, established in 1720.
The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) was established on May 17, 1792, under a buttonwood tree on Wall Street in New York City.
The first initial public offering (IPO) was by the Dutch East India Company in 1602.
Gold has been used as a form of currency for over 5,000 years.
The US dollar is the world's most traded currency.
The Great Depression was the longest and worst economic downturn in the history of the industrialized world.
In 2018, Amazon became the second company to reach a market value of over $1 trillion after Apple.
The biggest mergers and acquisitions (M&A) in history include the merger of Exxon and Mobil in 1999 and the acquisition of Time Warner by AOL in 2000.
The Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) is the world's largest futures and options exchange.
The London Stock Exchange (LSE) is the largest stock exchange in Europe by market capitalization.
The Black Monday stock market crash occurred on October 19, 1987, and was the largest single-day percentage decline in stock market history.
